reviewText:
Stigmat is a well-intentioned game with a large, unavoidable flaw: it thinks it is Super Meat Boy.

I can only assume our friends at Dagestan Technology took a look at Team Meat's success and tried to copy it as best as they could. Levels that change based on item pickups, meaningless hat accessories, and levels that are clearly far too difficult for the puny physics system implemented. As other reviewers noted, the first levels are unforgivably difficult which sets the tone for the whole game. As you continue, though, you realize that the satisfaction of completing a level is short-lived while the bad taste of a platformer that tries to hard to be something it's not lingers.

A decent platformer for those hardcore enthusiasts who enjoy brick-wall challenges and keyboard controls. For all else - just play Super Meat Boy.
voteText: 33 of 43 people (77%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I don't mind when a game is challenging.
I do mind when a game has sloppy mechanics and poorly designed, tiny stages. Not once did I get the feeling of achievement when completing a stage. It was always the continuous repetition and not my improving skill. Oh, there's also that one level with randomly generated obstacles that sometimes make it impossible for you to win (or even kill you during spawning). Yeah, I liked that one.

Honestly, instead of playing this, just pick up Super Meat Boy, everything is bigger and better there. And it's far more rewarding.

PS Don't dismiss my review because of my playtime, it's so low because I played offline.

reviewText: - No options menu. Particularly annoying since you can't remap buttons and the controller layout doesn't have a shoot" button. That button is used only in one level
date: you will need to switch to keyboard for that level.\n- Game is extremely short. Only 15 levels
recommended: with each level fitting in a single screen. Game can be completed in little more than an hour.\n- Music is repetitive. Not bad
hoursPlayed:
just repetitive.
- Some levels are poorly designed: the "shoot'em up style" level and the final boss are particularly annoying.

Could have been a good game with some extra effort from the devs.

Note for achievement collectors: the "no death run" achievement is bugged and you get it awarded simply for completing the game no matter how many deaths. A game almost impossible to 100% turns out to be relatively easy. Devs promised to fix it last Halloween but 6 months latter it's still bugged."

reviewText:
Everyone should play this game to learn what fake difficulty is.  This game is not difficult or unfair -- it's simply irritating and it tries to be.

This is what happens when someone watches a handful of XNA tutorial videos on YouTube, borrows every page from IWBTG's playbook, and decides to make a game.  What results is an irritating product that punishes the player for anything less than pixel-precise movements in some levels, and outright insults the players in others.

You think you've made it to the exit of a level?  Go ahead and run to the door and leave.  Surprise!  A giant boulder crushed you, and you have to start the level over again.  There was no hint of the boulder over the exit, but you're dead anyway.  Try to dodge it next time, maybe.

Trying to pilot this little spaceship thingy through a field of floating eyeballs?  Well, the locations and speeds of them are determined purely by chance, and all too often you won't have any room to navigate between them.  Try again; maybe the random number generator will go easy on you next time.

I can't come away from this game with any impression other than it's supposed to be a joke game".  Taking one look at the achievement list and seeing "Die 1000 times" as a legitimate achievement seems to confirm that.  Thing is
date: these types of games are simply pass√© now.  Games like IWBTG were funny novelties at the time
recommended: but their time has passed and they're not fun anymore.  This is a waste of time."

reviewText:
I normally enjoy a challenge, I welcome a game that requires reflexes and good timing but the levels on this game don't feel rewarding when I beat them, they just seem frustrating while I play them.
The level  design is quite claustrophobic, I get that it's part of the theme of the story but it narrows the jumping capabilities of your character and so the whole game has to accomodate to very short jumps; and though the levels change, the basic idea of jumping an obstacle is the only thing the game has to offer.

I would summarise my experience like this : it's not about getting a hold of the mechanics or improving one self but of repetition until completion.

reviewText: I got this part of a ¬£1 bundle but I'm still reviewing this fairly. Stigmat is a 2d platformer piggybacking of the recent success of games such as Super Meat Boy and Bloody Trapland. First off it's bad, extremely bad. The controls are terrible, feature no momentum and belong in a flash game. It has no story and boring level design to boot. I couldn't get it working at all with an Xbox or Steam Controller even though it claims support for both. The levels feature invisble walls, yes, even in a platformer. The Hats" are used as costume unlockables but are just purely plageristic or stale meme based jokes. I don't think I've ever actually played a less functional game not too mention that the game is hard for the sake of being hard. There is no enjoyment to be had here and it requires patience to learn where each level screws you over and gets you stuck to actually progress. 0/10
date: I wouldn't even bother with a free key let alone buying this!"

reviewText:
Press R to restart, I mean Stigmat,
is this short, platformer, and a frustrating little game. I beat it in ~ 100 minutes, with ~ 850 deaths.
In terms of the story, (which I don't necessarily feel it needs to be too sensical in a platformer) there is none. You get your eye taken out, and you go find the guy. In terms of playability though, its good fun for a person ( like me ) who has already beat games like Super Meat Boy, and enjoy a painful challenge.
But to anyone else, they might find the game much more painful than fun. The obstacles in this game are mainly spikes, (which will kill you even if you come 100 pixels too close to them) and any obstacles that might come flying at you once you've grabbed the key, (a recurring mechanic to unlock the door to progress.) I got this game as part of a bundle.(It came very cheap) and as I mentioned before, I only got 100 minutes out of it, but I did enjoy it. So, if you're into this sort of thing, I wouldn't buy it at full price (due to the shortness), but I would recommend it.

reviewText:
Hey, comrads! I am the composer of this game called Stigmat". And here it is  my special review for English-speaking players. This game has positive and some negative sides.
So let's start from pros:
+ Smooth textures and in general nice graphics. I can even say that players can feel the atmosphere of being underground.
+ Awesome visual effects wich also create beautiful image and make the game more dynamic.
+ Ruthless hardcore.
+ The game constantly throws up more "deadly suprises" even on each level.
+ You can customize your hero with different hats.
+ Frequent updates wich add different stuff and new levels.
And cons:
- Low FPS on old computers.
- Minor bugs (that you may not even meet).
- This game is bad for your nerves. :)

pss... HateBit loves you!"
